text.Prompt:
Conversation:
Frida: Come in, come in! Can I help you?
Jack: Professor Turner, are you giving your Advanced Geology course again next semester?
Frida: Yes.
Jack: I wonder if I could enroll in it, I know it's a graduate course and I'm only a junior, but...
Frida: Aren't you a bit young? I've allowed qualified seniors to take the course and they usually have a hard time to keep up.
Jack: I know, but the geology of the American West is my favorite interest and I've read a lot in the field. Last semester I took Professor Burman's course and I didn't find it challenging enough.
Frida: I see. You certainly aren't one of those students who are out for easy grades.
Jack: I should say not. I really want to learn something.
Frida: Well, I'll speak to Professor Burman, if he thinks you're ready, I'll let you enroll.
Jack: Oh, thanks. Prof. Turner, that's very nice of you.

Now write a summary of the conversation:
text.Response A: Jack wants to take a course of Professor Turner and Professor agrees if Jack achieves the allowance of Professor Burman.
text.Response B: In this conversation, Jack, a junior student, asks Professor Turner if she will be teaching her Advanced Geology course again next semester. She confirms that she will be, and he then asks if he can enroll in the course, even though he is only a junior. Professor Turner explains that the course is a graduate-level course and is difficult for even seniors. Jack explains that he has been interested in the geology of the American West for a long time and has been reading about it extensively. He also explains that he did not find Professor Burman's course challenging enough. Professor Turner agrees to speak with Professor Burman to see if he thinks Jack is ready for the course, and if so, she will allow him to enroll. In the end, Jack is very grateful to Professor Turner for allowing him to enroll in the course.
